date.title: Date
date.description: Date wraps both a rough date and an optional exact date.

exact.description: A day-precise date formatted as RFC3339.
exact.title: Exact date

deprecated.title: Deprecated
deprecated.description: Whether this API version is deprecated or not. Configure your software to notify you if this field is ever true so you aren't caught off-guard if this version is deprecated then eventually killed.

sets.title: Sets
sets.description: A superset of the sets in Standard, ordered from least recent release date (`enterDate.exact`) to newest. To get a list of Standard sets you MUST filter this array by comparing your local time to each set's enter and exit date, as the array by itself will contain sets that have already exited Standard as well as sets that have not yet entered it.

name.title: Name
name.description: The human-friendly name of the set, if known.

code.title: Code
code.description: Wizards of the Coasts's official code for the set.

codename.title: Codename
codename.description: Pre-launch development codename given to the set.

enterDate.title: Enter datetime
enterDate.description: The date this set enters or entered Standard.

exitDate.title: Exit datetime
exitDate.description: The date this set exits or exited Standard.

symbol.title: Symbol
symbol.description: A set of URLs to access this set's symbol.

common.title: Set symbol URL (common)
common.description: A URL to a set symbol in common coloring.

uncommon.title: Set symbol URL (uncommon)
uncommon.description: A URL to a set symbol in uncommon coloring.

rare.title: Set symbol URL (rare)
rare.description: A URL to a set symbol in rare coloring.

mythicRare.title: Set symbol URL (mythic rare)
mythicRare.description: A URL to a set symbol in mythic rare coloring.

bans.title: Bans
bans.description: Cards that have been banned from Standard, ordered from oldest ban to newest. This array may contain bans from a previous rotation; you should filter them out based on the provided set `setCode` and that set's exit date from Standard.

items.title: Card
items.description: A card currently banned from Standard.

name.title: Card name
name.description: The official English name of the banned card.

cardImageUrl.title: Card image URL
cardImageUrl.description: A URL to an image of the banned card.

setCode.title: Set code
setCode.description: The set the banned card was printed into, specified by its `code` property.

reason.title: Reason
reason.description: Human-readable description for why the card was banned.
examples: Banned for being too effective a shutdown against counters to aggressive red (filling the board with small creatures and gaining life).

announcementUrl.title: Announcement URL
announcementUrl.description: A URL to the page where Wizards of the Coast officially announced the card would be banned.
